Module ImageScalerFX
Package imagescalerfx.utils

Class ScaledThreadManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagescalerfx.utils.ScaledThreadManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class ScaledThreadManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    ScaledThreadManager

    Class to manage the process to scaling an image.

    Version:
    1.0.
    Author:
    Francisco David Manzanedo Valle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ScaledThreadManager​(ImageData imageData, javafx.scene.control.ListView<ImageData> imageDataListView)
      Initialize a Thread from the image and the list thaw will be update when the thread finished.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void run()
      Search a subfolder inside of the images folder with the same name that an associate image, if the subfolder exists, then its delete an created again.
      Then, de images are scaling from 10% to 90% of its original size.
      Each resulting scaled image is stored in its associate subfolder with a prefix indicating scaling factor.
      Finally, the images filenames are update in a ListView.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ScaledThreadManager

        public ScaledThreadManager​(ImageData imageData,
                           javafx.scene.control.ListView<ImageData> imageDataListView)
        Initialize a Thread from the image and the list thaw will be update when the thread finished.
        Parameters:
        imageData - ImageData object to be scaled
        imageDataListView - ListView that contains the names of the images.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Search a subfolder inside of the images folder with the same name that an associate image, if the subfolder exists, then its delete an created again.
        Then, de images are scaling from 10% to 90% of its original size.
        Each resulting scaled image is stored in its associate subfolder with a prefix indicating scaling factor.
        Finally, the images filenames are update in a ListView.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
